info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 6:04PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Hertford, northwestern Gates, Isle of Wight, eastern Southampton, east central Sussex and southeastern Surry Counties, the City of Franklin, the City of Suffolk and the central City of Newport News through 645 PM EDT... At 603 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Sedley, or near Courtland, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and heavy downpours. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Newport News, Franklin, Smithfield, Windsor, Courtland, Wakefield, Christopher Newport University, Downtown Suffolk, Holland, Suffolk, Isle Of Wight, Ivor, Newsoms, Como, Rescue, Hunterdale, Carrsville, Whaleyville, Driver and Sedley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
